properties.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued January 17 at 9:25AM MST until January 17 at 10:30AM MST by NWS Cheyenne WY
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in Cheyenne has issued a

* Snow Squall Warning for...
East central Carbon County in south central Wyoming...
Southwestern Albany County in southeastern Wyoming...

* Until 1030 AM MST.

* At 925 AM MST, a dangerous snow squall was located along
Interstate 80 between Elk Mountain and Arlington, or 39 miles east
of Rawlins, moving east at 25 mph.

HAZARD...Poor visibility in snow and blowing snow. Wind gusts
greater than 30 mph.

SOURCE...Radar indicated and highway cameras.

IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel.

*

This includes Interstate 80 in Wyoming between mile markers 239 and
293.

Locations impacted include...
Hanna, Medicine Bow, Rock River, Elk Mountain, Bow River Campground,
Deep Creek Campground and Arlington.
properties.instruction:
Reduce your speed and turn on headlights! During snow squalls, the
visibility may suddenly drop to near zero in whiteout conditions.

CMAMtext: Snow Squall Warning til 10:30 AM MST. Sudden whiteouts. Icy roads. Slow down! -NWS
